title: Challenger team looking for Coach.
body:
Paragon eSports White are currently looking for a experienced coach to help them on their road to the oceanic challenger series and hopefully onto the oceanic pro league. We are looking for someone to help the team in P/B Phase, Ingame decision making etc. 

Current ranked 5s win/lose 54-10, If you would like stats please message me on the client and i am happy to send you a copy of them.

The Current line up consists of
Top - Kanade - D5 (Can't catch a break in soloq)
Jungle - Kaios - Challenger 
Mid - Y x - Challenger
Ad Carry - Mundane Melon - D1
Support - mummy melon - Master
Nelis - Master (Substitute Jungler)

Not a lot of requirements for the position mainly only two.
1. Have some type of Coaching experience (preferably esports teams)
2. Have a solid attitude and work ethic towards esports and the team while also working hard to keep up with the meta of other regions.

If you are interested in the position please comment on this post, Add me in client (iNT Icarus PLT) and if you can email me at "lachiemiracleslol@gmail.com"

- Lachie "Miracle"
Owner of Paragon eSports

replies.body:
Hello,

I'm interesting in your offer, i will send you an e-mail do give you more description of what i do.
I'm from EU but recently moved in Auckland. My main account is obviously EU (west) so don't be worried about my OCE account (LvL 15).
I'll add you, if you have more question after seeing my e-mail, feel free.

Wouldn't you need to pay someone for this position? I find it hard to believe someone who enjoys playing League of Legends would be willing to do alot of hard work just cause... Offer them money or something lol

Yes, With saying that there is no point saying the position is paid on the post, since it will draw in multiple non experieced coaches lying about their experience so they can earn a few extra bucks without helping the team at all.

It will be more thoroughly discussed after our decision has been made and were confident on the person we have chosen.

Top - Kanade - D5 (Can't catch a break in soloq)

Why does he get an excuse in solo queue if others do not?

Me saying that kanade can't catch a break in soloq is more to say that he plays better in the team then he does in soloq also saying that he has had a bad run in soloq the last couple of weeks being in diamond 3 and being demoted down to diamond 5.

The others don't need an excuse being d1-challenger, all the players play well in a team based environment rather then playing in a soloq mentality.
